title: CryptoGames Accepts Binance Coin (BNB) as Payment: You Can Now Play Dice and 9 Other Games With BNB! | - Bitcoinist
content:
CryptoGames is a well-known and highly regarded online crypto casino that has gained a reputation for its fast transactions, impenetrable security, and an impressive selection of popular casino games. In an effort to continually improve the user experience, CryptoGames has consistently worked to optimize its transaction systems and now offers a range of cryptocurrency options for its players. Recently, in a groundbreaking move, CryptoGames announced the addition of Binance coin (BNB) to its list of supported coins, making the casino more accessible to the world of online gambling users that prefer using BNB. This decision reflects the casino’s commitment to staying at the forefront of technological advancement and providing its players with the most diverse and convenient options for making transactions in the casino.

What is Binance Coin (BNB)?

Before discussing the significance of CryptoGames accepting BNB as a payment option, it is important to understand what BNB is and how it is used. BNB is the abbreviation for Binance Coin, which is a cryptocurrency developed by the Binance exchange team. It was created to be used on the Binance platform as a means of paying fees for transactions, such as trading fees, listing fees, and withdrawal fees. BNB is the native token of Binance Smart Chain (BSC), which is a blockchain used to power the development of various platforms such as decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms that allow users to interact with a variety of financial services, such as lending, borrowing, and trading.

In addition to being used on the Binance exchange, BNB is also accepted by a growing number of merchants and can be bought and sold on a number of cryptocurrency exchanges. As of now, BNB is one of the top ten currencies based on market capitalization.

About CryptoGames

CryptoGames is a pioneering online cryptocurrency gambling platform that was launched in early 2020. It is owned and operated by MuchGamin B.V., a private limited liability company based in Curacao. The casino offers its users a wide range of games to choose from, including Dice, Dice v2.0, Slot, Roulette, Blackjack, Video Poker, Lottery, Minesweeper, Plinko, and their latest addition, Keno. These games can be played using any of the following 11 cryptocurrencies: Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum, Dogecoin, Neo Gas, Ethereum Classic, Monero, Bitcoin Cash, Dash, Binance coin, and Solana.

In addition to its diverse selection of games, CryptoGames also offers several highly rewarding programs, such as the Monthly Wagering Contest, Weekly Challenges, Progressive Jackpots, and the VIP Club. These programs provide players with the opportunity to win significant prizes, including up to 3.84 BTC through bitcoin wagering contests.

CryptoGames is known for its commitment to providing a fair and enjoyable gaming experience for its users. The casino uses a provably fair system, which allows users to verify the fairness of each game using cryptographic proof. This ensures that the games are completely random and unbiased, and that users have a fair chance of winning.

Why BNB is an Ideal Payment Option for CryptoGames:

There are several reasons why BNB is an ideal payment option for CryptoGames. First and foremost, BNB is a highly secure and stable cryptocurrency, with a strong development team behind it. This ensures that transactions made using BNB are reliable and safe. In addition, BNB is known for its low transaction costs and fast transaction speeds, which make it an efficient and convenient option for online gambling transactions.

Another advantage of BNB is its widespread acceptance. As mentioned previously, BNB is accepted by a growing number of merchants and can be bought and sold on a number of cryptocurrency exchanges. This means that users who prefer using BNB as their primary cryptocurrency have more options for obtaining and using it, making it easier for them to play at CryptoGames.

Furthermore, BNB has a strong track record of adoption and growth within the cryptocurrency industry. Binance, the company behind BNB, is one of the largest and most respected cryptocurrency exchanges in the world, and BNB has consistently ranked among the top cryptocurrencies based on market capitalization. This indicates that BNB is a viable and widely accepted cryptocurrency, which adds to its appeal as a payment option for CryptoGames.

How to Play Dice and Other Games Using BNB at CryptoGames

At CryptoGames, users can enjoy a variety of exciting games, including Dice and 10 other options, using Binance Coin (BNB). This cryptocurrency has been added to the list of supported currencies at the online casino due to its low transaction costs and fast transaction speeds, as well as its strong development team. To make a deposit and begin playing, users simply need to complete one network confirmation, which happens quickly and seamlessly.

To play a game of Dice on CryptoGames:

Visit CryptoGames. Create an account at the casino and make a deposit using a supported cryptocurrency, such as BNB. Once you have funds available in your account, go to the Dice game page and select the amount you want to bet. Choose the odds of winning and the payout multiplier for your bet. The higher the odds, the lower the payout multiplier will be, and vice versa. Roll the dice by clicking the “Roll Over” or “Roll Under” button. The outcome of the roll will determine whether you win or lose the bet. If you win the bet, your winnings will be credited to your account balance. You can then choose to continue playing or cash out your winnings instantly.

Overall, the addition of BNB to CryptoGames’ list of supported currencies satisfies the needs and preferences of both the casino and its users, making it an ideal choice for gameplay.

Try BNB at CryptoGames Today!

In conclusion, the addition of Binance coin (BNB) to CryptoGames’ list of supported coins is a significant development that reflects the casino’s commitment to staying at the forefront of technological advancement and providing its users with the most diverse and convenient options for making transactions. BNB is a highly secure and stable cryptocurrency with low transaction costs and fast transaction speeds, making it an ideal payment option for online gambling. Its widespread acceptance and strong track record of adoption and growth within the cryptocurrency industry also add to its appeal as a payment option for CryptoGames. Overall, the addition of BNB to CryptoGames is a win-win situation for both the casino and its users.

CryptoGames has consistently demonstrated its commitment to providing its users with a fair and enjoyable gaming experience, and the addition of BNB as a payment option is yet another example of this commitment. By offering BNB as a payment option, CryptoGames is able to cater to the needs and preferences of a wider range of users, which helps to increase the overall satisfaction of its user base.

Moreover, the adoption of BNB as a payment option by CryptoGames is a testament to the growing popularity and acceptance of cryptocurrency within the online gambling industry. As more and more online casinos follow suit and begin accepting cryptocurrencies as payment, it is likely that we will see a continued increase in the use of cryptocurrency in the online gambling space.

Overall, the addition of BNB as a payment option to CryptoGames is a significant development that will benefit both the casino and its users. By offering a highly secure and convenient payment option, CryptoGames is able to provide its users with an even better gaming experience, while also staying at the forefront of technological advancement and catering to the needs of a wider range of users.

title: Top 5 altcoins to watch in 2023 - Crypto expert's list - Finbold - Finance in Bold
content:
Alternative coins (altcoins) have remained suppressed for several months, a situation complicated by the extended cryptocurrency bear market. Indeed, in the past, altcoins rallied thanks to interest from retail investors, but they have failed to pick up as the crypto market was hit with instances such as the FTX exchange collapse and soaring inflation.

However, cryptocurrency investors hope 2023 will come with positive tidings and put behind the 2022 sell-off. In this line, in a YouTube video on January 1, crypto trading expert Michaël van de Poppe identified specific altcoins to look out for in 2023. Below are the altcoins identified by the analyst:

Chainlink (LINK)

According to Poppe, Chainlink (LINK) is currently in an accumulation zone like the general market. He noted that the token is likely to bottom in the range of about $4 to $5 and will benefit from a possible relief rally once the Federal Reserve slows down on its monetary policy.

In the meantime, he noted that the token is exhibiting a historical cycle similar to the one recorded in 2019.

With the analyst projecting further correction for LINK, he suggested that the token could interest investors focusing on decentralized finance (DeFi). He said that 2023 will likely form the best moment to accumulate LINK, stating that the asset will likely take off in 2024 or 2025.

By press time, LINK was trading at $5.60, with a correction of about 0.4% in the last 24 hours. At the current price level, Poppe stated that LINK is facing resistance at around $7.80, and breaching the level could lead to a further continuation with a focus on $16.85.

Chainlink one-day price chart. Source: Finbold

On technical analysis, LINK’s summary of the one-day daily gauges from TradingView recommends ‘sell’ at 14 while moving averages are going for a ‘strong sell’ at 13. For oscillators, the gauges are ‘neutral’ at 8.

Chainlink technical analysis. Source: TradingView

Polkadot (DOT)

Poppe pointed out that the interoperability blockchain token is being hammered by the crypto price movement, stating that it’s getting stretched irrationally. Besides the prevailing bear market, the analyst noted that DOT is being affected by the lawsuit against the Gemini crypto exchange, considering the relationship between the two entities.

While projecting a relief rally later in 2023, Poppe projected that DOT could rally between $16 to $24. By the time of publishing, DOT was trading at $4.35, recording daily gains of about 0.37% within the last 24 hours.

Polkadot one-day price chart. Source: Finbold

Elsewhere, DOT’s technical analysis summary is for the ‘sell’ sentiment at 13, while moving averages are for a ‘strong sell’ at 13.

Polkadot technical analysis. Source: TradingView

Cosmos (ATOM)

Similarly, for Cosmos (ATOM), Poppe stated that the price movement could replicate the 2019 and 2020 trading patterns where the asset consolidated before rallying again. He suggested that at the current price, ATOM offers an opportunity for investors to accumulate while projecting that the asset is likely to gain to a region above $25 in the event of a relief rally.

However, he expressed scepticism if the current price movement could lead to a bottom. At the moment, ATOM is trading at $9.45 with minor gains of 0.65% in the last 24 hours.

Cosmos one-day price chart. Source: Finbold

As ATOM consolidates, the token’s summary of daily technical analysis on TradingView is for ‘sell’ at 10, similar to moving averages at 8. The token’s oscillators are recommending a ‘neutral’ sentiment at 8.

Cosmos technical analysis. Source: TradingView

Binance Coin (BNB)

Additionally, Poppe stated that Binance Coin (BNB) should form part of any portfolio because it is provided by the largest crypto exchange Binance. In this line, the analyst believes that BNB can benefit if the general crypto market rallies again. However, he cautioned BNB prospects largely depend on how Bitcoin (BTC) performs.

At the same time, as reported by Finbold, crypto experts at TradingShot through TradingView projected that BNB could be among the best investments in 2023.

BNB is still consolidating, trading at $245 with a correction of about 0.5 % in the last 24 hours.

BNB one-day price chart. Source: Finbold

Furthermore, BNB technical analysis summary on a daily basis is going for the ‘sell’ sentiment at 15 while moving averages are for ‘strong sell’ at 14. On the other hand, the oscillator gauges are for neutrality at 9.

BNB technical analysis. Source: TradingView

Skale (SKL)

Finally, the trading expert noted that interoperable, multichain network Skale (SKL) has the potential to rally, citing the platform’s strong foundation. He suggested that if SKL breaks the $0.025 resistance, it will take the previous highs and start rallying to the zone of $0.20. Currently, SKL is trading at $0.02.

Skale one-day price chart. Source: Finbold

Despite the analyst identifying SKL’s foundation as a critical trigger for the rally, the token’s technical analysis summary on TradingView aligns with ‘sell’ at 16. Moving averages are for a ‘strong sell’ at 14, while oscillators are for ‘buy’ at 4.

Skale technical analysis. Source: TradingView

In conclusion, the highlighted altcoins movement will largely be determined by how the general crypto market reacts to prevailing factors like macroeconomic elements such as rising inflation. Furthermore, the market is still feeling the effects of the FTX crypto exchange implosion, and how the matter is concluded will be key.

Disclaimer: The content on this site should not be considered investment advice. Investing is speculative. When investing, your capital is at risk.

title: Binance Users Can Now Utilize Apple Pay and Google Pay - BSC NEWS
content:
BNB

The move opens the Binance ecosystem up to the nearly 70 million users actively linked with the payment services.

Binance Adds Google and Apple Pay

Users of Binance can now make payments with Google Pay and Apple Pay. The new payment integrations diversify the payment opportunities for Binance users and increase the accessibility of the application.

Users can now exchange money from their Google or Apple pay accounts for cryptocurrencies on their iOS or Android devices in the same way they could shop in a store.

#BinanceBuild update:



Apple Pay and Google Pay payment options are now available on #Binance!



Purchase crypto, with ease 🫡 pic.twitter.com/iXKUtvLYeG — Binance (@binance) December 29, 2022

Both applications are among the most used digital payment apps in the world. Google Pay has 25 million, and Apple Pay has over 43 million users.

Binance links more popular payment methods to the centralized finance world with the move. The integration of the two popular digital payment services is a major step for mass adoption due to the potential user impact.

Binance.US only supports Apple Pay of the two payment services at this time. Users of the US franchise arm of Binance cannot use Google Pay.

What is Binance:

Binance positions itself as the world’s leading blockchain ecosystem and crypto-asset infrastructure provider with a financial product suite that includes the largest digital asset exchange by volume. The Binance platform aims to increase the freedom of money for users and features a comprehensive portfolio of crypto-asset products and offerings, including trading and finance, education, data and research, social good, investment and incubation, decentralization, and infrastructure solutions.

Where to find Binance:
